current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to improve the patient navigator program.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Training, background checks, and nondisclosure for patient navigators

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1311(i) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:i

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue guidance on the implementation of this paragraph in order to protect the privacy of individually identifiable information submitted to, or accessed by, navigators under this subsection.

text.#text: Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this paragraph, the

An entity that receives a grant under this subsection shall ensure that universal background checks are conducted on all employees of the entity prior to such employees providing navigator services to individuals, or prior to such employees having access to individually identifiable information as a result of providing such services.  Such background checks shall, at minimum, include a criminal background check, fingerprinting, and credit report.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:i/p:7/sp:B/cl:i

text.#text: An individual who has been found guilty of a felony, or guilty of a misdemeanor involving deceit or dishonestly (including identity theft, fraud, or perjury), under Federal or State law shall not be employed by an entity described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall have sworn or taken an oath that he or she will not disclose any individually identifiable information obtained in the course of their employment (except information relevant to the commission of a felony when provided to an appropriate law enforcement authority).
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:i/p:7/sp:C/cl:ii

text.#text: Prior to commencing employment  with an entity that receives a grant under this subsection, an individual described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: as a navigator, a non-navigator assistant, or as an employee with access to individually identifiable information.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:i/p:7/sp:C/cl:i

text.#text: An individual is described in this clause if such individual is being employed by an entity described in

Prior to conducting navigation services for an entity under this subsection, an individual shall meet educational and licensure requirements that are identical or comparable to those currently applicable to health insurance agents and brokers within the State in which they seek to provide navigation services, including the completion of at least 30 hours of training (including training on privacy rights under this Act and other relevant Federal laws).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in instances of failure to comply with requirements of this paragraph, including where consumer outreach and enrollment assistance causes harm to an individual as a result of misuse or negligence in protection and privacy of individually identifiable information;

text.#text: shall issue guidance concerning how liability and penalties will be applied by the

shall determine whether such liability lies with the navigator or non-navigator assistance personnel involved or whether liability lies with the entity that received the grant under this subsection; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: are required to obtain professional liability coverage.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:i/p:7/sp:E/cl:ii

text.#text: shall determine whether the individuals or  entities identified under
Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this paragraph, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , publishes or communicates any individually identifiable information which comes into his or her possession by reason of his or her being employed (or otherwise providing services) under this subsection, shall be fined not more than $5,000 or imprisoned not more than 5 years, or both.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:i/p:7/sp:C

text.#text: Whoever having sworn or taken the oath  described under

Any person
				who knowingly and falsely represents that such person is, or holds himself or
				herself out as, a navigator under this subsection shall be fined not more than $5,000 or imprisoned not more than 5 years, or both.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with the intent to sell, transfer, or use individually identifiable information for commercial advantage, personal gain, or malicious harm shall be fined not more than $250,000, imprisoned for not more than 10 years, or both.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:i/p:7/sp:F/cl:i

text.#text: A person who commits the offense described under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (or a person purporting to be such a navigator, counselor, or other employee).

text.#text: Any applicable individual who for any month failed to obtain minimum essential coverage as a result of the good faith reliance on the advice of a patient navigator, counselor, or other employee of an entity receiving a  grant under
